quotes.quote: How I feel about myself is more important than how I look. Feeling confident, being comfortable in your skin   that's what really makes you beautiful.
Like anyone else, there are days I feel beautiful and days I don't, and when I don't, I do something about it.
Beauty is how you feel inside, and it reflects in your eyes. It is not something physical.
I feel beautiful when I'm at peace with myself. When I'm serene, when I'm a good person, when I've been considerate of others.
It's not vanity to feel you have a right to be beautiful. Women are taught to feel we're not good enough, that we must live up to someone else's standards. But my aim is to cherish myself as I am.

And barefoot or first thing in the morning, I feel beautiful. Because I feel like me. I didn't always feel that way, but I feel that way now. When somebody just loves you, and when you make somebody happy, when your presence seems to make them happy, you suddenly feel like the most beautiful person in the world.
Although beauty may be in the eye of the beholder, the feeling of being beautiful exists solely in the mind of the beheld.
It's important to feel beautiful; it's political to feel beautiful.
I know now that it's really important to feel beautiful. There is a power to that.
But looking beautiful isn't, I think, as important as feeling beautiful.

You've got to get up every morning with a smile on your face / And show the world all the love in your heart / Then people gonna treat you better / You're gonna find, yes you will / That you're beautiful as you feel.
I don't look my best when I wake up. But, I do feel beautiful when I'm tired and happy and I've had a good laugh and a glass of champagne.
When I lay my head on the pillow at night I can say I was a decent person today. That's when I feel beautiful.
Nothing makes a woman more beautiful than the belief that she is beautiful.
You need to feel beautiful on your own before a guy can make you feel beautiful, because it wont be a healthy relationship.
I want to feel beautiful, like when he told me I was.
You should feel beautiful and you should feel safe. What you surround yourself with should bring you peace of mind and peace of spirit.
I never think, Oh, I'm so beautiful. To me, feeling happy is more important.
I feel most beautiful at night, when I take my makeup off and it's just me.
I believe that how you feel is very important to how you look - that healthy equals beautiful.
Personally, I don't ever want to depend on makeup to feel beautiful.
To be beautiful means to be yourself. You don't need to be accepted by others. You need to accept yourself.
Love yourself first, and everything else falls into line.
Beauty does not always feel beautiful.
Looking beautiful starts by feeling beautiful.
The first question I ask myself when something doesn't seem to be beautiful is why do I feel it's not beautiful? And very shortly you discover there is no reason.
Confidence is the ability to feel beautiful without needing someone to tell you.
Despite the message of self-doubt and inadequacy hammered home by the beauty industry, the truth is simple: If you feel gorgeous, you'll look gorgeous.
Beauty can't amse you, but brainwork— reading, writing, thinking— can.

I am so beautiful, sometimes people weep when they see me. And it has nothing to do with what I look like really, it is just that I gave myself the power to say that I am beautiful, and if I can do that, maybe there is hope for them, too. And the great divide between the beautiful and the ugly will cease to be. Because we are all what we choose.
I was sweaty, and my hair was matted all over the place. And I was happy and hot and accomplishing a lot and running around, and I could feel my heart beating, and I felt beautiful.
Taught from infancy that beauty is woman's sceptre, the mind shapes itself to the body, and roaming round its gilt cage, only seeks to adorn its prison.
I think that the longer I look good, the better gay men feel.
Any girl can be glamorous. All you have to do is stand still and look stupid.
There is a certain age when a woman must be beautiful to be loved, and then there comes a time when she must be loved to be beautiful.
Now that I'm pregnant I feel beautiful for the first time in my life.
Remind yourself everyday that you are beautiful, whether you struggle to believe that or you already know.
I think I'm a very pretty girl. I'm never going to pretend to think otherwise.
I am comfortable in my clothes. I am naturally beautiful. I recognize that I have true beauty.
I see myself as sexy. If you are comfortable with it, it can be very classy and appealing.
I am healthy and attractive. I am free of negativity. I see myself as beautiful.
Beauty is about being comfortable in your own skin . It's about knowing and accepting who you are.
Beauty as we feel it is something indescribable: what is or what it means can never be said.
Beauty is momentary in he mind— / The fitful tracing of a portal; /  But in the flesh it is immortal; / The body dies; the body;s beauty lives.
Research shows the way someone feels about their looks has a far greater effect on their quality of life than how they actually look.
Recognising this difference (how you look versus how you feel about how you look) is the first step to feeling more beautiful.
What really makes me feel beautiful is that I can finally feel the powerful emotion of love.
All that matters to me now is that people see me as a beautiful woman, and for the first time in my life, I feel beautiful.
What we don't get is no one can make us feel beautiful, unless we know and we feel that we are.
I'm beautiful because I can feel it, I can taste it, I can smell it. It's all over me. I have a big heart, a beautiful heart. Anyone that comes in contact with me will always feel my beauty.
There is nothing to do except to be just who you are. You have the right to feel beautiful and enjoy it.
What matters is how you feel inside, because feeling beautiful on the inside is key to looking good.
I think that glamour is about confidence. I think however somebody feels beautiful, that's glamour.
As a woman, I believe you have to embrace your body, and feel beautiful both inside and out.
Beauty is really all about confidence. If you feel beautiful, then you are beautiful.
'You can't be beautiful,' Brandy says about a thousand times, 'until you feel beautiful.'
I contend that every woman has the right to feel beautiful, no matter how scrambled her features, or how indifferent her features.
